member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Work.TaskParameter.DownSample(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Reduce memory usage by downsampling the image. Aspect ratio will be kept even if width/height values are incorrect. Uses pixels units for width/height
member.returns: The TaskParameter instance for chaining the call.
member.param: Optional width parameter, if value is higher than zero it will try to downsample to this width while keeping aspect ratio.
Optional height parameter, if value is higher than zero it will try to downsample to this height while keeping aspect ratio.
Whether to upscale the image if it is smaller than passed dimensions or not; if null the value is taken from Configuration (false by default)

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Work.TaskParameter.DownSampleInDip(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Reduce memory usage by downsampling the image. Aspect ratio will be kept even if width/height values are incorrect. Uses device independent points units for width/height
member.returns: The TaskParameter instance for chaining the call.
member.param: Optional width parameter, if value is higher than zero it will try to downsample to this width while keeping aspect ratio.
Optional height parameter, if value is higher than zero it will try to downsample to this height while keeping aspect ratio.
Whether to upscale the image if it is smaller than passed dimensions or not; if null the value is taken from Configuration (false by default)

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Work.TaskParameter.DownSampleMode(FFImageLoading.Work.InterpolationMode)
member.summary: Set mode for downsampling. Speed-wise: nearest neighbour > linear > cubic.\ Default: bilinear On Android it's always ignored as Android uses bitmap insamplesize downsampling (bilinear)
member.returns: The TaskParameter instance for chaining the call.
member.param: Optional mode parameter, if not set, defaults to linear.

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Work.TaskParameter.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resource used by the object.
member.remarks: Call when you are finished using the . The method leaves the in an unusable state. After calling , you must release all references to the so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the was occupying.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this bitmap memory optimizations.
member.value: true if bitmap memory optimizations; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:FFImageLoading.Config.Configuration.StreamChecksumsAsKeys
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this stream checksums as keys.
member.value: true if stream checksums as keys; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:FFImageLoading.Config.Configuration.FadeAnimationEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this fade animation enabled.
member.value: true if fade animation enabled; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating wheter fade animation for cached or local images should be enabled.

member.name: P:FFImageLoading.Config.Configuration.FadeAnimationDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the default duration of the fade animation in ms.

member.name: P:FFImageLoading.Config.Configuration.TransformPlaceholders
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this transforming place is enabled.
member.value: true if transform should be applied to placeholder images; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:FFImageLoading.Config.Configuration.DownsampleInterpolationMode
member.summary: Gets or sets default downsample interpolation mode.
member.value: downsample interpolation mode

member.name: P:FFImageLoading.Config.Configuration.AllowUpscale
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether upscaling should be used in / functions if the image is smaller than passed dimensions
member.value: true if upscaling is allowed; otherwise, false

member.name: P:FFImageLoading.Config.Configuration.HttpHeadersTimeout

member.value: The http connect timeout.

member.name: P:FFImageLoading.Config.Configuration.HttpReadTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum time in seconds to wait before the HTTP request is cancelled.

member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the http read buffer.

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum size of the memory cache in bytes.

member.summary: Enables / disables verbose performance logging. WARNING! It will downgrade image loading performance, disable it for release builds!
member.value: The verbose performance logging.

member.summary: Enables / disables verbose memory cache logging. WARNING! It will downgrade image loading performance, disable it for release builds!

member.summary: Enables / disables verbose image loading cancelled logging. WARNING! It will downgrade image loading performance, disable it for release builds!
member.value: The verbose image loading cancelled logging.

member.name: P:FFImageLoading.Config.Configuration.VerboseLogging
member.summary: Enables / disables verbose logging. IMPORTANT! If it's disabled are other verbose logging options are disabled too
member.value: The verbose logging.

member.name: T:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.IFixedSizePriorityQueue`2
member.summary: A helper-interface only needed to make writing unit tests a bit easier (hence the 'internal' access modifier)

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.IFixedSizePriorityQueue`2.Resize(System.Int32)
member.summary: Resize the queue so it can accept more nodes. All currently enqueued nodes are remain. Attempting to decrease the queue size to a size too small to hold the existing nodes results in undefined behavior

member.name: P:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.IFixedSizePriorityQueue`2.MaxSize
member.summary: Returns the maximum number of items that can be enqueued at once in this queue. Once you hit this number (ie. once Count == MaxSize), attempting to enqueue another item will cause undefined behavior.

member.name: T:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.IPriorityQueue`2
member.summary: The IPriorityQueue interface. This is mainly here for purists, and in case I decide to add more implementations later. For speed purposes, it is actually recommended that you *don't* access the priority queue through this interface, since the JIT can (theoretically?) optimize method calls from concrete-types slightly better.

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.IPriorityQueue`2.Enqueue(`0,`1)
member.summary: Enqueue a node to the priority queue. Lower values are placed in front. Ties are broken by first-in-first-out. See implementation for how duplicates are handled.

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.IPriorityQueue`2.Dequeue
member.summary: Removes the head of the queue (node with minimum priority; ties are broken by order of insertion), and returns it.

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.IPriorityQueue`2.Clear
member.summary: Removes every node from the queue.

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.IPriorityQueue`2.Contains(`0)
member.summary: Returns whether the given node is in the queue.

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.IPriorityQueue`2.Remove(`0)
member.summary: Removes a node from the queue. The node does not need to be the head of the queue.

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.IPriorityQueue`2.UpdatePriority(`0,`1)
member.summary: Call this method to change the priority of a node.

member.name: P:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.IPriorityQueue`2.First
member.summary: Returns the head of the queue, without removing it (use Dequeue() for that).

member.name: P:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.IPriorityQueue`2.Count
member.summary: Returns the number of nodes in the queue.

member.name: T:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.SimplePriorityQueue`2
member.summary: A simplified priority queue implementation. Is stable, auto-resizes, and thread-safe, at the cost of being slightly slower than FastPriorityQueue Methods tagged as O(1) or O(log n) are assuming there are no duplicates. Duplicates may increase the algorithmic complexity.
member.typeparam: The priority-type to use for nodes. Must extend IComparable<TPriority>

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.SimplePriorityQueue`2.#ctor
member.summary: Instantiate a new Priority Queue

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.SimplePriorityQueue`2.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IComparer{`1})
member.summary: Instantiate a new Priority Queue
member.param: The comparer used to compare TPriority values. Defaults to Comparer<TPriority>.default

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.SimplePriorityQueue`2.#ctor(System.Comparison{`1})
member.summary: Instantiate a new Priority Queue
member.param: The comparison function to use to compare TPriority values

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.SimplePriorityQueue`2.GetExistingNode(`0)
member.summary: Given an item of type T, returns the exist SimpleNode in the queue

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.SimplePriorityQueue`2.AddToNodeCache(FFImageLoading.Concurrency.SimplePriorityQueue{`0,`1}.SimpleNode)
member.summary: Adds an item to the Node-cache to allow for many methods to be O(1) or O(log n)

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.SimplePriorityQueue`2.RemoveFromNodeCache(FFImageLoading.Concurrency.SimplePriorityQueue{`0,`1}.SimpleNode)
member.summary: Removes an item to the Node-cache to allow for many methods to be O(1) or O(log n) (assuming no duplicates)

member.name: P:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.SimplePriorityQueue`2.Count
member.summary: Returns the number of nodes in the queue. O(1)

member.name: P:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.SimplePriorityQueue`2.First
member.summary: Returns the head of the queue, without removing it (use Dequeue() for that). Throws an exception when the queue is empty. O(1)

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.SimplePriorityQueue`2.Clear
member.summary: Removes every node from the queue. O(n)

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.SimplePriorityQueue`2.Contains(`0)
member.summary: Returns whether the given item is in the queue. O(1)

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.SimplePriorityQueue`2.Dequeue
member.summary: Removes the head of the queue (node with minimum priority; ties are broken by order of insertion), and returns it. If queue is empty, throws an exception O(log n)

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.SimplePriorityQueue`2.EnqueueNoLockOrCache(`0,`1)
member.summary: Enqueue the item with the given priority, without calling lock(_queue) or AddToNodeCache(node)

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.SimplePriorityQueue`2.Enqueue(`0,`1)
member.summary: Enqueue a node to the priority queue. Lower values are placed in front. Ties are broken by first-in-first-out. This queue automatically resizes itself, so there's no concern of the queue becoming 'full'. Duplicates and null-values are allowed. O(log n)

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.SimplePriorityQueue`2.EnqueueWithoutDuplicates(`0,`1)
member.summary: Enqueue a node to the priority queue if it doesn't already exist. Lower values are placed in front. Ties are broken by first-in-first-out. This queue automatically resizes itself, so there's no concern of the queue becoming 'full'. Null values are allowed. Returns true if the node was successfully enqueued; false if it already exists. O(log n)

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.SimplePriorityQueue`2.Remove(`0)
member.summary: Removes an item from the queue. The item does not need to be the head of the queue. If the item is not in the queue, an exception is thrown. If unsure, check Contains() first. If multiple copies of the item are enqueued, only the first one is removed. O(log n)

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.SimplePriorityQueue`2.UpdatePriority(`0,`1)
member.summary: Call this method to change the priority of an item. Calling this method on a item not in the queue will throw an exception. If the item is enqueued multiple times, only the first one will be updated. (If your requirements are complex enough that you need to enqueue the same item multiple times and be able to update all of them, please wrap your items in a wrapper class so they can be distinguished). O(log n)

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.SimplePriorityQueue`2.GetPriority(`0)
member.summary: Returns the priority of the given item. Calling this method on a item not in the queue will throw an exception. If the item is enqueued multiple times, only the priority of the first will be returned. (If your requirements are complex enough that you need to enqueue the same item multiple times and be able to query all their priorities, please wrap your items in a wrapper class so they can be distinguished). O(1)

members.member: Get the head of the queue, without removing it (use TryDequeue() for that). Useful for multi-threading, where the queue may become empty between calls to Contains() and First Returns true if successful, false otherwise O(1)

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.SimplePriorityQueue`2.TryDequeue(`0@)
member.summary: Removes the head of the queue (node with minimum priority; ties are broken by order of insertion), and sets it to first. Useful for multi-threading, where the queue may become empty between calls to Contains() and Dequeue() Returns true if successful; false if queue was empty O(log n)

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.SimplePriorityQueue`2.TryRemove(`0)
member.summary: Attempts to remove an item from the queue. The item does not need to be the head of the queue. Useful for multi-threading, where the queue may become empty between calls to Contains() and Remove() Returns true if the item was successfully removed, false if it wasn't in the queue. If multiple copies of the item are enqueued, only the first one is removed. O(log n)

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.SimplePriorityQueue`2.TryUpdatePriority(`0,`1)
member.summary: Call this method to change the priority of an item. Useful for multi-threading, where the queue may become empty between calls to Contains() and UpdatePriority() If the item is enqueued multiple times, only the first one will be updated. (If your requirements are complex enough that you need to enqueue the same item multiple times and be able to update all of them, please wrap your items in a wrapper class so they can be distinguished). Returns true if the item priority was updated, false otherwise. O(log n)

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.SimplePriorityQueue`2.TryGetPriority(`0,`1@)
member.summary: Attempt to get the priority of the given item. Useful for multi-threading, where the queue may become empty between calls to Contains() and GetPriority() If the item is enqueued multiple times, only the priority of the first will be returned. (If your requirements are complex enough that you need to enqueue the same item multiple times and be able to query all their priorities, please wrap your items in a wrapper class so they can be distinguished). Returns true if the item was found in the queue, false otherwise O(1)

member.name: P:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.GenericPriorityQueueNode`1.Priority
member.summary: The Priority to insert this node at. Must be set BEFORE adding a node to the queue (ideally just once, in the node's constructor). Should not be manually edited once the node has been enqueued - use queue.UpdatePriority() instead

member.name: P:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.GenericPriorityQueueNode`1.QueueIndex
member.summary: Represents the current position in the queue

member.name: P:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.GenericPriorityQueueNode`1.InsertionIndex
member.summary: Represents the order the node was inserted in

member.name: T:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.GenericPriorityQueue`2
member.summary: A copy of StablePriorityQueue which also has generic priority-type
member.typeparam: The values in the queue. Must extend the GenericPriorityQueue class

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.GenericPriorityQueue`2.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Instantiate a new Priority Queue
member.param: The max nodes ever allowed to be enqueued (going over this will cause undefined behavior)

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.GenericPriorityQueue`2.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.IComparer{`1})
member.summary: Instantiate a new Priority Queue
member.param: The max nodes ever allowed to be enqueued (going over this will cause undefined behavior)
The comparer used to compare TPriority values.

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.GenericPriorityQueue`2.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Comparison{`1})
member.summary: Instantiate a new Priority Queue
member.param: The max nodes ever allowed to be enqueued (going over this will cause undefined behavior)
The comparison function to use to compare TPriority values

member.name: P:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.GenericPriorityQueue`2.Count
member.summary: Returns the number of nodes in the queue. O(1)

member.name: P:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.GenericPriorityQueue`2.MaxSize
member.summary: Returns the maximum number of items that can be enqueued at once in this queue. Once you hit this number (ie. once Count == MaxSize), attempting to enqueue another item will cause undefined behavior. O(1)

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.GenericPriorityQueue`2.Clear
member.summary: Removes every node from the queue. O(n) (So, don't do this often!)

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.GenericPriorityQueue`2.Contains(`0)
member.summary: Returns (in O(1)!) whether the given node is in the queue. O(1)

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.GenericPriorityQueue`2.Enqueue(`0,`1)
member.summary: Enqueue a node to the priority queue. Lower values are placed in front. Ties are broken by first-in-first-out. If the queue is full, the result is undefined. If the node is already enqueued, the result is undefined. O(log n)

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.GenericPriorityQueue`2.HasHigherPriority(`0,`0)
member.summary: Returns true if 'higher' has higher priority than 'lower', false otherwise. Note that calling HasHigherPriority(node, node) (ie. both arguments the same node) will return false

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.GenericPriorityQueue`2.Dequeue
member.summary: Removes the head of the queue (node with minimum priority; ties are broken by order of insertion), and returns it. If queue is empty, result is undefined O(log n)

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.GenericPriorityQueue`2.Resize(System.Int32)
member.summary: Resize the queue so it can accept more nodes. All currently enqueued nodes are remain. Attempting to decrease the queue size to a size too small to hold the existing nodes results in undefined behavior O(n)

member.name: P:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.GenericPriorityQueue`2.First
member.summary: Returns the head of the queue, without removing it (use Dequeue() for that). If the queue is empty, behavior is undefined. O(1)

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.GenericPriorityQueue`2.UpdatePriority(`0,`1)
member.summary: This method must be called on a node every time its priority changes while it is in the queue. Forgetting to call this method will result in a corrupted queue! Calling this method on a node not in the queue results in undefined behavior O(log n)

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.GenericPriorityQueue`2.Remove(`0)
member.summary: Removes a node from the queue. The node does not need to be the head of the queue. If the node is not in the queue, the result is undefined. If unsure, check Contains() first O(log n)

member.name: M:FFImageLoading.Concurrency.GenericPriorityQueue`2.IsValidQueue
member.summary: Should not be called in production code. Checks to make sure the queue is still in a valid state. Used for testing/debugging the queue.

member.name: T:FFImageLoading.Views.ICachedImageView
member.summary: This interface is used to unify view properties / methods across all platform specific implementations
